diagnosis.primary: Classic Hodgkin Lymphoma (CHL), Nodular Sclerosis type
diagnosis.sitesOfInvolvement: Mediastinum (Bulky, MMR > 0.33), Supraclavicular nodes, Para-aortic nodes, Spleen
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: B symptoms present (Drenching night sweats, 8% weight loss)

treatmentPlan.modality: Combined Modality Therapy (Chemotherapy followed by Radiation)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV_ISRT_MultiSite - Consolidative ISRT to initially involved sites.
treatmentPlan.priorSystemicChemo: 6 cycles of ABVD/AVD. Interim PET after 2 cycles was Deauville 4, End of Chemo PET was Deauville 3.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine on wing board with Vac-Lok bag for immobilization. Arms up. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT of chest and abdomen acquired for ISRT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET/CT for target delineation.

dosimetry.constraints: Heart V25 < 10%; Total Lung V20 < 30%; Kidney Mean < 15 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Consolidation IMRT to multiple sites (mediastinum, SCV, para-aortic) post-chemo.

fractions.sideEffects: Mild fatigue. Early erythema in SCV region.
fractions.notes: Tolerating RT well. No esophagitis reported.

imagingAndReports.summary: Bulky mediastinal adenopathy (11 cm). Supraclavicular and para-aortic nodes enlarged. Splenomegaly.
Intensely FDG-avid bulky mediastinal mass (MMR 0.4). Avid SCV and para-aortic nodes. Diffuse splenic uptake. Stage IIIB-S.
Significant decrease in size/avidity of nodes. Moderate residual uptake > liver (Deauville 4).
Further response. Residual mediastinal tissue with low-grade uptake <= liver (Deauville 3).
CT acquired supine for ISRT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET/CT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: 36yo M presents with B symptoms. Biopsy NS-CHL. Staging PET/CT confirms Stage IIIB disease with bulky mediastinum. IPS=2. Discussed treatment options (e.g., ABVD vs. newer regimens). Plan: Start ABVD x 2, then interim PET to guide further therapy.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Interim PET shows Deauville 4 response. Discussed options: continue ABVD/AVD vs escalate chemo. Given good tolerance and significant improvement, plan to continue ABVD/AVD pathway and plan for consolidation RT post-chemo.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 6 cycles (2 ABVD + 4 AVD). Tolerated relatively well, required G-CSF support intermittently. End of Treatment PET shows good response (Deauville 3). Refer to Rad Onc for consolidation RT to initial sites of bulky disease/involvement.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Kevin Black (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p chemo for Stage IIIB CHL, near CR (Deauville 3). Plan for consolidation ISRT to mediastinum, SCV, para-aortic regions to 30.6 Gy / 17 fx. Discussed rationale (consolidate response, esp in initially bulky areas), RT technique (IMRT preferred for OAR sparing), potential side effects (fatigue, skin rxn, esophagitis, low risk pneumonitis/cardiac tox). CT Sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Kevin Black (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 5/17 fx RT. Mild fatigue reported. Early erythema in SCV region. No esophagitis. Tolerating well. Setup verification images reviewed (CBCT daily), no significant shifts. Continue RT.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Curative-intent treatment. Consolidation radiation after chemotherapy to improve cure rates, especially in areas of initially bulky disease.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Fatigue, skin redness in chest/neck, sore throat/esophagitis, potential nausea or diarrhea from abdominal radiation. Late: Small long-term risk of hypothyroidism, heart disease, lung inflammation (pneumonitis), and secondary cancers. These risks are minimized with modern IMRT techniques.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Report severe sore throat, difficulty swallowing, cough, or shortness of breath.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use topical creams or mouthwash as recommended.
